result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle M Katorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Danielle M Katorski in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 months JAIL without work release, consecutive to any other sentence.  (Credit -0 days).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year may be served in Milwaukee County
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;	
No contact with G.S., K.S., and J.K.
Condition Time: 30 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence Friday 3/18/2016 @ 5:00 pm.  
Restitution: $4,100.00 to be paid to G. & K. Scott as a condition of probation
COSTS:  $253.00, bail to be applied remainder to be paid as a condition of probation
Sentencing hearing at 03-16-2016 10:00 am
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
